t: Psalm 38
A Psalm of David, to bring to remembrance.
O*p Lord,*s rebuke me not in thy wrath: neither chasten me in thy hot displeasure.
For*p thine arrows stick fast in me, and thy hand presseth me sore.
There*p is no soundness in my flesh because of thine anger; neither is there any rest in my bones because of my sin.
For*p mine iniquities are gone over mine head: as an heavy burden they are too heavy for me.
My*p wounds stink and are corrupt because of my foolishness.
I*p am troubled; I am bowed down greatly; I go mourning all the day long.
For*p my loins are filled with a loathsome disease: and there is no soundness in my flesh.
I*p am feeble and sore broken: I have roared by reason of the disquietness of my heart.
Lord,*p all my desire is before thee; and my groaning is not hid from thee.
My*p heart panteth, my strength faileth me: as for the light of mine eyes, it also is gone from me.
My*p lovers and my friends stand aloof from my sore; and my kinsmen stand afar off.
They*p also that seek after my life lay snares for me: and they that seek my hurt speak mischievous things, and imagine deceits all the day long.
But*p I, as a deaf man, heard not; and I was as a dumb man that openeth not his mouth.
Thus*p I was as a man that heareth not, and in whose mouth are no reproofs.
For*p in thee, O Lord,*s do I hope: thou wilt hear, O Lord my God.
For*p I said, Hear me, lest otherwise they should rejoice over me: when my foot slippeth, they magnify themselves against me.
For*p I am ready to halt, and my sorrow is continually before me.
For*p I will declare mine iniquity; I will be sorry for my sin.
But*p mine enemies are lively, and they are strong: and they that hate me wrongfully are multiplied.
They*p also that render evil for good are mine adversaries; because I follow the thing that good is.
Forsake*p me not, O Lord:*s O my God, be not far from me.
Make*p haste to help me, O Lord my salvation.
